attributes.action: now that the British people have voted , we need an updated  magna carta
attributes.background: now that the British people have voted to leave the eu, one of the wrongs needs to be righted, a British bill of rights is needed to include an updated people's magna Carta to include the original laws but updated for the 21st century, also if possible to be signed &  agreed by the head of state
attributes.additional_details: the magna Carta was signed by the then head of state king John, to protect the people's rights for lawful imgresses, parts of the laws were watered down or revoked by various people over the centuries, therefore losing said rights, but some still stand as of today & as this was the peoples choice to leave the eu, those in charge, parliment etc, should now be held accountable by the said people as/if the  need arises

attributes.action: Companies/organisations fined for hate speech in uniform/insignia or on premises
attributes.background: As a deterrant against post-referendum racism and to encourage a wider sense of collective social responsibility, we believe that penalty fines should be served on registered companies and organisations that own the uniform, insignia, premises or property in/with which an act of hate speech occurs.

attributes.action: Petition for a referendum to decide on a 2nd British referendum on EU membership
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to implement a referendum to decide on whether another EU referendum will take place. If the yes vote is more than 60%, then a second EU referendum, also with a 60% majority threshold requirement for the winning side, should be held.

attributes.action: A second referendum should be carried out in the event that the EU reforms.
attributes.background: Due to fears of other countries exiting the EU, a reformation may take place within the union. If this does occur, then the UK should have another opportunity to decide whether it wishes to remain in a reformed EU or not, prior to the triggering of Article 50.
attributes.additional_details:
Scotland may well be having another referendum for their independence due to the changed circumstances between the UK and the EU. Similarly, should EU reformation occur, the circumstances will  have changed. Therefore, the UK should be given the opportunity to have a new referendum on its membership in the EU.

This should be carried out prior to the triggering of Article 50 to ensure that our position and influence in the EU is maintained.

attributes.action: Abolish the monarchy and the house of lords as UK voted for democracy.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to abolish the monarchy and the house of lords as they are unelected and a barrier to having a full democracy in the UK. This is something that has proven to be a public priority with it helping to secure a leave vote in the recent EU referendum.

attributes.action: Review campaign rules / media regulation on stigmatisation of demographic groups
attributes.background: In the UK, loosely regulated media and political propaganda has been used extensively to stigmatise and marginalise demographics, particularly those in minority groups. More should be done to protect groups and individuals from becoming targets for political or financial gain.
attributes.additional_details: Media content and political campaigns, including headlines, tag lines, articles or information and imagery, specifically taken out of context or construed with the intention to promote concern, fear and isolation of any group or culture that exists fairly under UK law, should be regulated to protect the public from attacks of violence and hatred.

attributes.action: Bring the perpetrators of rape in the Democratic Republic of Congo to justice.
attributes.background:
Young girls and I mean young [under 5 in some cases] are being taken from their homes gang rapped and then left. 

I would like the UK to put pressure on the Congo offering police help if needed to stop this wave of rape and oppression of young girls.
attributes.additional_details:
You can see the story here
https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/jun/20/girls-gang-raped-suspects-free-democratic-republic-congo-president-kabila?CMP=share_btn_fb

attributes.action: Call for a vote of no confidence in PM Cameron post EU referendum.
attributes.background: In the event of a leave majority in the forth coming EU referendum we the people request that all Members of Parliament be made directly aware by the House of Commons Speaker to the announcement of our desire for a vote of no confidence in Prime Minister David Cameron.

attributes.action: To make August Bank Holiday Monday reclassified as ‘England Day.’
attributes.background: Given the rich and illustrious history of England, I propose that this day be given a new name and purpose and call it 'England Day?’ By a stroke of good fortune, historical evidence suggests that this time of year coincides with the emergence of England as single sovereign state, 1091 years ago.
attributes.additional_details: Living in England is a great privilege and we should celebrate this. The transition from Bank Holiday Monday to England Day, couldn’t be simpler or more convenient, coming in late summer it would be part of the three-day holiday. This proposal is not competing with St George’s Day. This proposal seeks to promote a public holiday that already exists, by giving it status and relevance. If this idea appeals to you, please add your name to the petition.

attributes.action: Make vaccine inserts mandatory to receive before being given any vaccination.
attributes.background: This isn't about being pro or anti vaccinations. This is about knowledge and being able to make an informed choice in whichever choice you choose.
attributes.additional_details: By reading the vaccine insert it will help educate the person on the possible adverse reactions, it will help parents notice vaccine damage a lot earlier if it arises, you will be able to read the study details and see all ingredients in the vaccination before deciding to go ahead with them.

attributes.action: Mandatory air rifle registration with a 2 year period to register.
attributes.background:
Make mandatory registration of air rifles.
Currently in the UK anyone can own an air rifle & use these to illegally shoot on lands without permission committing the acts of armed trespass and poaching.
Some shoot pets escape prosecution and costs owners thousands of pounds!
www.ukgunbook.com
attributes.additional_details:
By making registration mandatory ( 2 year period to register ) it will help solve crimes of pets that have been shot and / or killed.
It will also make sure that owners are punished for offences committed with their weapons.
We dont want to stop people shooting, we just want to ensure those that own weapons are using them sensibly, on lands with permission.
Similar to the UK Gunlaws on ShotGun ownership.
£15 per weapon registration and £10 per year renewal fees for up to 10 serialised weapons.

attributes.action: Make a ‘car mode’ setting a mandatory feature on all new smartphones.
attributes.background:
We believe that car mode will reduce the number of accidents on our roads.
Specifically, car mode would, when activated, and until such time it was turned off. Disable all phone calls, text messages and any form of application-based alerts that require the user to interact with the phone.
attributes.additional_details:
26% of all car accidents were caused by drivers using a mobile device (1 in 4). Connected Driver Survey 2015 - MORI Social Research Inst. 

Dialing a phone increases you chance of having an accident by 12 times while reading or writing a text increases your chances of having an accident tenfold.
According to a RAC Foundation survey, 60% of people "would be happy to use a 'vehicle safe mode' on external devices in cars."

attributes.action: Debate the EU's Five Presidents’ Report & its likely impact on the UK.
attributes.background:
The report proposes the completion of Europe’s Economic, Monetary & Political Union.  It uses the terms 'euro area' and 'EU' in relation to its propositions; thus a likely impact on non-euro sovereign states such as the UK.
My concern is that our MPs are not fully aware of its content or impact.
attributes.additional_details:
The report can be accessed at: https://ec.europa.eu/priorities/publications/five-presidents-report-completing-europes-economic-and-monetary-union_en.
It states, 'And finally, towards a Political Union that provides the foundation - - - '. 
It uses doublespeak such as, 'The euro is a successful and stable currency', not withstanding the intractable problems a common currency has given countries such as Greece.

attributes.action: Hillsborough families compensated in full for 27 years of legal fees.
attributes.background: The Hillsborough victims families have for 27 years had to pay their own legal fees unearthing the truth of what happened on 15/04/89. The South Yorkshire Police and others held responsible for the tragedy that day have had their legal fees paid by the tax payer. Another miscarriage of justice.
attributes.additional_details: The families of the 96 people who died at Hillsborough have had to endure 27 years of pain and heartache uncovering what they always knew was the truth. The families themselves and campaign groups have had to find exorbitant amounts of money to fund a fight that should never have had to be fought whilst the establishment have continued to fund their cover up and lies fully funded by the tax payer.

attributes.action: Erect a statue of a famous woman on Parliament square.
attributes.background: Parliament Square has statues of famous men in history. There are many women of importance that have contributed to our democracy surely this should be reflected in our most important landmark. Example Emily Pankhurst helped give women the vote.

attributes.action: Invest more money into front line policing increase number of response officers
attributes.background:
More and more officers are being assaulted each year. With the lack of numbers it will soon become a huge safety issue. 

On top of that, too often we hear the story that response officers to not have the time, resources or funding to deal with/investigate an offence.
attributes.additional_details: 2015 saw a police officer assaulted every 22 minutes in England & Wales. This is a growing number and we need to invest to protect not only the public from these damaging cuts but the officers themselves.

attributes.action: Urge the NHS to back the 8-week blood sugar diet method to avoid T2 Diabetes.
attributes.background: Increasing numbers of people are recovering from type 2 diabetes without drugs using the nutrition based 8-week blood sugar diet method at a time when instances of limb amputations, blindness and other complications are rising dramatically.
attributes.additional_details:
Reference 1: "The 8-week blood sugar diet method" by Dr Michael Mosley and Prof. Roy Taylor

Reference 2: Colin Beattie MSP (successful use of this method)

Reference 3: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/health/article-3404259/Eat-beat-diabetes-just-eight-weeks-s-life-changing-diet-help-avoid-reverse-Type-2-diabetes-best-s-tasty-way-health.html

attributes.action: Ban advertising of alcohol, restrict opening times, picture of damaged liver
attributes.background:
In September of this year my partner Claire died due to long term alcohol dependancy, more or less my last words to Claire was that I was going to try and help others in the same situation. 

Being alcohol dependant doesn't just effect the person it also effects close family and friends
attributes.additional_details:
What people don't realise is what damage drinking too much  alcohol can do, in many cases people with liver disease don't have any noticeable symptoms until their live is badly damaged. 
Those systems are.
Jaundice,Oadema, swelling in abdomen, itchy skin, weakness and muscle wasting,insomnia nose bleeds and bleeding gums.
To give you some figures on alcohol abuse it cost the NHS  £2000 per day for a level 3 patient on intensive care It is commonly said that it costs overall to the society £21 bn

attributes.action: Make it illegal to require disclosure of current  salary on a job application
attributes.background: Candidates are often dismissed as unsuitable if their current salary is more than 10% removed from the salary of the role they are applying for.  This discourages career advancement as well as job mobility between industries with different pay grades.  Candidates should be assessed on merit alone.
attributes.additional_details: Employers use current salary as a baseline to make an offer to a successful candidate, leading to a situation where two candidates can be paid vastly different amounts for the same role – this discourages social mobility and gender equality by ensuring that employees who are paid less than their colleagues are unable to catch up even when moving jobs.   Candidates can also fail to be considered for a role if their current salary is not in the same range as the role they are applying for.

attributes.action: Raise awareness about Motorcyclist for drivers. Add a Section for Practical test
attributes.background:
Many Car drivers are not very aware of Motorcyclist. I have seen many fatal accidents and it is now time to raise awareness for learners and normal drivers.
If they fail to show any awareness about Motorcyclist they must retake their test.

attributes.action: All products with gelatine must be labelled clearly,animal or vegetable gelatine
attributes.background: There are many products on the market which contain gelatine. Gelatine is found in our foods, sweets and in our pharmaceutical products,these are just a few examples. Clear labelling on EVERY product that contains gelatine and what type of gelatine it is, be it from animals or vegetables.

attributes.action: Ensure all Cafcass calls and meetings are recorded and both parties get a copy
attributes.background: Due to personal experience of having a Cafcass telephone interview not reflect my issues, I began to look at net mums and other site representative of both sexes and I've found many people found this happening. All calls and meetings should be recorded for safety to ensure key information is saved.
attributes.additional_details: Since most organisations like insurances record calls it seems a serious failing data gathered in the best interest of a child is not recorded. If a report does not reflect what a parent or other person says the recording could be sent to court to validate the person. A report missing key information causes distress and goes against the person as the court presume Cafcass to be efficient. Recording provides proof for all parties.

attributes.action: Review the Council Tax system so that it reflects individual contributions
attributes.background: I believe that the current Council Tax system is outdated and unfair - taxing households rather than individuals - Why should single households pay almost as much as a 5 occupancy household, why should a property worth millions pay same as a council flat?
attributes.additional_details:
Tax should be paid on individual bases and proportional to each person burden to the local authority - Should 2 pensionnaires household pay same council tax as a family of 5? Should a single working professional pay towards services it does not currently use?
Also with property valuation completely changed from 25 years ago - should household taxation still be considered an option? 
On top of that local councils have constantly risen tax/year and discrepancies between boroughs are huge.

attributes.action: We demand that the government guarantees adequate future funding for the NHS
attributes.background: The NHS is in dire risk of future collapse, due primarily to the pressure of inadequate funding from the government. We ask this and future governments to guarantee that the NHS will continue to be a free and full health service, and to commit to funding levels set by an independent expert body.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-37331350

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-35653455

https://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/sep/10/hospitals-on-brink-of-collapse-say-health-chiefs

http://metro.co.uk/2016/09/11/nhs-is-at-tipping-point-as-hospitals-struggle-with-severe-lack-of-funds-6121127/

http://www.itv.com/news/2016-09-11/cash-strapped-hospitals-face-unpalatable-choices-over-care-levels-warns-nhs-chief/

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/08/25/glut-of-nhs-closures-ahead-warn-hospital-chiefs/

attributes.action: Employment Support Allowance needs to be changed for people who work.
attributes.background: After being signed off work due to Mental Health problems, I was extremely disappointed to find out that after DWP checked my last twelve months National Insurance contributions I didn't qualify for Employment Support Allowance. In the past 18 months I have reduced my hours due to health problems.
attributes.additional_details: If people are suffering with accident/illness it is fairly common that may have  to reduce their hours to help them through. Therefore, it would be better to no longer use the time limit of twelve months to check NI Contributions when calculating if they qualify for Employment Support Allowance. It think its fair to say it would be better to look at what has been paid for all the years they have worked. This ruling needs to be changed to support workers who are going through difficult times.

attributes.action: Making it easier for adults to be diagnosed with autism
attributes.background: Having been diagnosed with autism in my adult life, which was not easy to do, I want to help adults get help being diagnosed a lot easier

attributes.action: Sellers should complete building survey before the property goes on the market
attributes.background: When selling a property the building survey should be completed by the seller before it can go on the market, so that all parties involved are aware of any serious defects.This would expediate the process for buyers, who often only discover the property's faults late in the process, but also sellers
attributes.additional_details: Although the current rules are supposed to offer protection, as Sellers are meant to inform Buyers of serious defects if a previous sale has fallen through etc this is often not enforced. Instead late in the process, after the Buyer has already paid for a host of surveys, the true cost of the property becomes apparent. Having the survey completed first would make everyone aware of all issues at the start of the process, making life easier for all involved.

attributes.action: Personally apologise to HM Forces personnel dismissed due to their sexuality.
attributes.background:
Thousands of serving gay military personnel suffered intrusive investigations into their sexuality, losing homes, careers and friends. Many faced homelessness, rejection and no suitable alternative career. Many experience unemployment and poor mental health, even now.
We demand a personal apology.
attributes.additional_details:
Not one individual subjected to investigation and dismissal from HM Forces, has ever received an apology. 
In 2007, the MOD provided a watery statement of recognition, but  many didn't know about it and it certainly wasn't personal. 
There is a moral obligation to apologise for this treatment. The effects of these investigations are still very real for these people.
Given the law in this area was only repealed in the 2016 revision of the Armed Forces Bill, the time is right to apologise.

attributes.action: Make it an offence to protest at an equality event or celebration
attributes.background:
Events that celebrate or try to raise awareness of equality issues In the UK should be safe places. 
If you attend a pride or rally, you shouldn't have to face people who are protesting against your human rights & entitlements.
Protesting (even peacefully) at these events should be an offence!
attributes.additional_details:
Equality is for everybody. 
I agree that all are entitled to an opinion but an opinion that affects somebody's rights should be kept to yourself. 

People who are celebrating, I.e. Gay pride, deserve to feel safe & to be in a non-judgemental environment at these events. With protesters there, you often find arguments start, abuse & threats are often directed at those celebrating. 


Humans rights are for everyone, regardless of any factor.

attributes.action: Government inquiry in to the award of the 2016 East Anglian Rail Franchise.
attributes.background:
Despite abysmal performance and failing the customer for many years, Abellio have been rewarded the East Anglian franchise.

We call for a full pubic review into this decision and a reassessment of the competitive bids.

attributes.action: Train more doctors.
attributes.background: To meet future demands for healthcare, whilst managing the hours worked by doctors, we need more doctors.  There are currently lots of talented people who want to train as doctors but can't because there are not enough places at medical schools.
attributes.additional_details: As well as increasing the number of training places available to people aged 18, the number of places available to people in their 20's (both with and without a first degree in another subject) should be significantly increased to improve access to medicine as a career.  Currently to secure a place at medical school you have to demonstate an excellent academic record, a committment to medicine and a track record of helping others, usually by the age of 17.

attributes.action: Impose restrictions on corner shops / off-licence shops using plastic bags.
attributes.background: We saw clear decline of using plastic bags after imposing 5p charge which benefit the environment a great deal. It is time to impose restrictions or small charge on corner shops / takeaways /  off-licence shops  etc.This will further cut out the mess on our streets and will benefit small business

attributes.action: Allow Armed forces personal to carry side arms for protection against abduction.
attributes.background: Due to the fact there gave been person's attempting abductions against our service personnel it is time to allow them to carry loaded side arms for protection against abduction.
attributes.additional_details: RAF Marham. Aldershot

attributes.action: Child Maintenance Services should penalise applicants who misuse the service
attributes.background: At present Child Maintenance Services only panalise the paying parent, There are no penalties for applicants who purposely abuse the service (see additional details below)
attributes.additional_details: Where an applicant has purposely witheld the child(ren) from a loving parent, and the paying parent has asked to have access or shared care and has shown evidence to have tried to arrange a private arrangement to provide for the childs needs but the applicant has deliberately choosen to withold the child in order to profit from child maintenance, then they should be fined £1000 and made to pay the money back where the courts rule in favour of the parent seeking custody

attributes.action: Stop state funded translation services in all NHS facilities.
attributes.background: The NHS spend over £23M per year on providing translation services - that's around £63,000 per day !!  That money could and should be spent on equipment/services that benefit everyone instead of a small minority.
attributes.additional_details:
Translation services that are required should be paid for by the person requiring the services, their friends, family or privately funded migrant support groups.
Implementing this change get will not only reduce expenditure on non medical NHS funding but also provide an additional incentive for migrants to learn English and assimilate into UK society.

attributes.action: Make the government take a more active role in providing food for those in need.
attributes.background: We are campaigning on behalf of over 1.1 million people in the UK who have needed emergency food supplies from The Trussell Trust in the last year (1). Food bank usage is on the rise, but we believe it is the government's responsibility to provide food for their people, not that of the food banks.
attributes.additional_details:
The emergency food supplied by The Trussell Trust is estimated as less than half the number of the total amount of emergency food supplies distributed in the UK (2). However the government plan to cut welfare by £3bn by 2020 (2).

References:
1. https://www.trusselltrust.org/news-and-blog/latest-stats/#fy-2015-2016
2. http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/food-bank-usage-at-record-high-reveals-trussell-trust-a6984921.html

attributes.action: stop the WPD from making radical changes to existing final salary schemes
attributes.background: All existing final salary schemes were signed  by the individual and the company after full explanation of the contents and should be legally binding .They should not be able to be manipulated by Ministers or the Work and Pensions department years later .

attributes.action: Review on Police Cautions
attributes.background: Police Cautions are to be used as an alternative to prosecution in minor cases. However they are so frequently used that people who accept them are unaware of the future implications of having a caution. Regulations & review on the dispensation of a police caution and length on a record is required.
attributes.additional_details:
It has become increasingly apparent the implications of a police caution and unfortunately it is not realised until it is too late. The bodies able to dispense a caution, police and CPS, often work together and it is a biased system in that those who investigate also give the reprimand.
The following links shed some light on this matter.
http://www.govyou.co.uk/remove-cautions-from-crb/
https://iaingould.co.uk/2013/06/03/a-caution-is-for-life-not-just-for-christmas/

attributes.action: Look to the future and make the UK an officially Athiest state.
attributes.background: Religion is a divisive influence on modern society. Blind faith and superstition is a mentality of the past. Atheism is our only chance for a successful globally united and peaceful future.  The U.K. should take the lead and show the way by not promoting ANY religion at state level.
attributes.additional_details: My references are religions complete lack of evidence.

attributes.action: Make St George's day a public holiday.
attributes.background: Theresa May's first act as Prime Minister should be to make St George's day a public holiday thereby uniting all of England through patriotism as well as helping to boost the British Economy.

attributes.action: Allow all people with terminal conditions access to trial drugs.
attributes.background: Developing drugs is a lengthy process. When drugs first display effectiveness, the path to approval for use is a long one, to ensure the benefits outweigh any potential risks. But nothing is more risky than death and the terminally ill may be denied potentially life saving treatments in this wait.
attributes.additional_details: The current process of drug development for the terminally ill leaves patients with little power or hope. It feels like what the patient wants is being ignored. In some cases drugs are denied from the rest of the patient population for years after being shown to save lives in the condition, allowing avoidable death on a massive scale. There are many terminal conditions that share this frustration affecting adults and children and babies. Everyone should have the right to the best chance to live.

attributes.action: Tighten regulation on news media to prevent the manipulation of public opinion.
attributes.background: The recent referendum showed that some newspapers were heavily pushing their readership to vote a specific way, readers who only used those newspapers to make their decision may have voted without balanced arguments and hence may have been subject to manipulation of opinion by the newspaper itself.
attributes.additional_details: All news media organisations that publish in the public domain should hold a responsibility to provide a balanced view, rather than only printing facts or opinion that support the organisations own stance. The impartiality rules that govern the BBC’s political stance, should be considered for the rest of the news media organisations. The public needs to be provided with balanced facts and opinions to allow them to make their own decisions, rather than be steered by an organisations own view.

attributes.action: Issue a Travel Warning for the USA due to high gun crime and police brutality
attributes.background: Travel Warnings remain in place until situations change; some have been in effect for years. The ongoing police brutality and high gun crime in the USA is a potential threat to any tourist. Citizens should be advised of this danger and encouraged to avoid the USA until there are gun/police reforms.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for all non-vehicular road users to wear hi-viz
attributes.background: In daylight or dusk, hi-viz is highly visible to road users.  To reduce the number of accidents on the road, we call for the Government to make it a legal requirement for all road users to wear hi-viz clothing including, but not limited to, motorcyclists, cyclists, runners, walkers and horse-riders.

attributes.action: Debate the UN report on human rights abuses and austerity
attributes.background:
The UN has produced a report which states the UK’s austerity policies are in breach of international human rights obligations.
The UN are “seriously concerned” by the state of inequality in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
UN report: E/C.12/GBR/CO/6
Download here:
http://tbinternet.ohchr.org/_layouts/treatybodyexternal/SessionDetails1.aspx?SessionID=1059&Lang=en

attributes.action: Hold General Election once a Tory leader's found & before Artcle 50 is triggered
attributes.background: The U.K. Government should represent the people of the U.K.  Following the recent referendum both major parties at Westminster have seemingly imploded. Once new party leaders have been found the UK should decide who is right to govern them.
attributes.additional_details: This should also be done before Article 50 is invoked so that the Prime Minister leading the negotiations has the backing of the people

attributes.action: Parliament should set up an Office for Electoral Information Integrity.
attributes.background: In the modern age it is possible for all well intentioned MP's to sometimes present incorrect information or correct information in a misleading way. This erodes public confidence both in MPs as well as in the whole political system, which ultimately undermines democracy.
attributes.additional_details:
The OEII would have the following functions:
1) define and publish standards for information impartiality and comprehensibility
2) provide advice to MPs on how best to present information in an impartial and generally comprehensible way
3) during the purdah period in the run up to elections or referenda, it would scrutinise information placed in the public domain by political parties or groups and would issue public statements describing how the presented information is deficient when needed.

attributes.action: Require candidates to have lived for 5 years in the area they want to be MP in.
attributes.background: Our MPs seem increasingly divorced from the people who elect them. This isn't helped by all parties choosing to parachute non local candidates into constituencies with which they have no links. Making it compulsory to live within the constituency for 5 years before standing would stop this practice
attributes.additional_details: According to Smith Institute Data, MPs have a very different background to the electorate. 33% are privately educated and 23% went to Oxbridge. The number of professional politicians in parliament has risen from 3.7% to 25% since 1979 while the % of manual workers has fallen from 15.8 to 4. Too often the party central offices are choosing candidates from the Westminster village and sending them to stand in seats in the provinces where they are unrepresentative of the people voting for them

attributes.action: Reduce corporation tax to less than 12.5% give companies a reason to stay in UK
attributes.background: Post Brexit vote we need immediate action from the government as many companies will already be planning to leave the UK. Time is of the essence and we need to halt a mass exodus of  businesses and secure jobs for Britain. In-party politics should take second place to measures such as this.

attributes.action: make a new law to force landlords to allow pets in rented properties
attributes.background: all pets deserve a loving home and this is being taken away by landlords refusing to allow pets so I ask all animal lovers to support this and get the government to make a new law forcing landlords to allow pets in rented properties
